title: Enable rendering of XAML not present in visual tree into image for WinRT 8.1
body: With WinRT 8.1 new functionality has been added to render XAML as an image but the XAML has to be added to the visual tree. It would be nice to be able to render XAML that is not on the visual tree and perhaps in a background task.

comments.body: Also needed for off-screen rendering of FrameworkElement to sprite, which is repeated on a charting/graphic component www.scichart.com

I have multiple WP silverlight apps. I am using custom live tiles rendered from ui elements with writeable bitmap. I want to make my apps universal apps using winrt. But winrt does not support any rendering without elements in visual tree. Why?

I really need this feature. I have a program that creates plots using OxyPlot with data the user can select, but because parsing the data takes awhile I do this not on the UI Thread and let my user go do other stuff. But I want to create a small sized image as thumbnail and send it to a cloud service together with the data without forcing the end-user to a certain page just to show the image a second and render it out and afterwards navigate back to where he was.
